title: Kacper Majchrzak
text:
Kacper Majchrzak (born 22 September 1992) is a Polish <a href="Swimming%20%28sport%29">swimmer</a>. He currently represents the <a href="Cali%20Condors">Cali Condors</a> which is part of the <a href="International%20Swimming%20League">International Swimming League</a>.
Majchrzak competed in the <a href="Swimming%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%2050%20metre%20freestyle">50 m freestyle</a> and <a href="Swimming%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%204%20%C3%97%20100%20metre%20medley%20relay">4 × 100m medley relay</a> events at the <a href="2012%20Summer%20Olympics">2012 Summer Olympics</a>. He finished 10th in the <a href="Swimming%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20200%20metre%20freestyle">200 metre freestyle</a> at the <a href="2016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a> setting a new <a href="List%20of%20Polish%20records%20in%20swimming">national record</a> of 1:46.30.
Career.
International Swimming League.
In 2019 he was a member of the inaugural <a href="International%20Swimming%20League">International Swimming League</a> representing the <a href="Cali%20Condors">Cali Condors</a>, who finished third place in the final match in Las Vegas, Nevada in December. Majchrzak competed in the 100 meter and 200 meter freestyle events as well as all 3 relay events throughout the season.
